revised_title: Loess Deposition and River Valley Formation in South England and France
tldr: The author, Joseph Prestwich, investigates the origin of loess deposits in the valleys of South England and France, connecting them to the formation of river valleys and fluviatile high and low-level gravels. He suggests that loess, high-level gravels, and low-level gravels were all formed by floodwaters, providing evidence of the magnitude of these floods and their erosive power. This explanation harmonizes with the hypothesis of greater water volume carried down by rivers in the past.
